Description: Southwest Airlines Co. settled a lawsuit involving allegations that it  violated Federal Aviation Administration safety regulations in its maintenance of its Boeing 737s. The settlement required operational changes by Southwest designed to enhance its oversight of and control over third parties that perform maintenance on Southwest aircraft. Southwest also agreed to pay a $2.8 million civil penalty and up to $5.5 million in deferred civil penalties if it does not implement the operational changes set forth in the settlement agreement.
Agency: Federal Aviation Administration referral to the Justice Department
